Rep. Mike Pence ( R-IN), framed it as an effort to deny government funding for abortions. "The time has come to deny all federal funding to Planned Parenthood of America," Mike Pence said. I've authored the Title X Abortion Provider Prohibition Act, which would deny Title X funds to Planned Parenthood or any other abortion provider and Congress must act and act now to move this important legislation. the company needed a more mature leader. Eric Schmidt , 55, will remain an adviser to Page and Google Inc. 's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , as Google Inc. 's executive chairman. The changes will be effective April 4. In my clear opinion, Larry is ready to lead and I'm excited about working with both him and Sergey Brin for a long time to come, Eric Schmidt said. Page praised Eric Schmidt , too. "There is no other CEO in the world that could have kept such headstrong founders so deeply involved and still run the business so brilliantly," Page said.

, from 1998 to 2001. Vint Cerf said Eric Schmidt had been chief executive for 10 years- "a nice round number"- and Page was ready to lead the company into the future. Larry and Sergey are 10 years older than they were when they thoughtfully hired Eric Schmidt to be the CEO... so everybody's growing up, Vint Cerf said. Google has grown over the past decade from a start-up battling other Internet search engines into a technology giant with nearly 25,000 employees and annual revenue of nearly USD30 billion. to running for governor' Saying "we choose Indiana," U.S. Rep. Mike Pence shut the door Thursday on seeking the presidency in 2012 but left unanswered whether his choice instead is the Indiana governor's office. I'm open to running for governor, Mike Pence said in an exclusive interview with The Indianapolis Star. "We're going to take the next several months to travel across the state and hear what Hoosiers have to say. We'll seriously consider it.

Mike Pence into the 2012 presidential race is under way, with a veteran of the Ronald Reagan White House launching a petition drive on Monday urging him to enter the primary contests," the AP writes. Ralph Benko, a deputy counsel to Ronald Reagan , announced the America's Barack Obama Committee to encourage a Pence-for-president bid. Bill Clinton Michele Bachmann Jim Ryan, R-Kan., is also helping the campaign to collect signatures from conservatives and tea party activists. ROMNEY: A new McClatchy Newspapers-Marist poll shows Barack Obama leading Mitt Romney in a hypothetical matchup, 51-38. "In their December survey, Mitt Romney was leading Barack Obama 46-44 percent," CNN writes. spoke
